Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2013 03:57AM brown471 wrote: Ok, so now the lab says that there was an error when they tested my sample...something wrong with their calibration and they need another specimen from my doctor. My doctor says this has been sent and I will have to start the 2-3-or 4 week wait all over again. In the meantime no one seems to be sure whether I should start chemo or wait for this test result and I am confused as heck. Any ideas?
Posts.Title: Oncotype test-waiting and waiting.... brown471 SpecialK

Posts.Content: brown471 wrote: I feel like I'm in limboland waiting to see what's next and it all hinges on this test result. The oncologist ordered the test on 7/10/13, 5 days after my double mastectomy and he said the results would take 3 weeks. The results still aren't here. Anyone else wait this long? I feel like I want to get on with it already...chemo or not and I don't like the feeling of sitting around waiting when I should maybe be doing something. Dx 6/13/2013, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/6 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 6/18/2013 Lumpectomy: Right Surgery 7/5/2013 Mastectomy: Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Left Chemotherapy 8/23/2013 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Hormonal Therapy 11/15/2013 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Oncotype test-waiting and waiting.... brown471 SpecialK

Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2013 04:28AM brown471 wrote: Yeah. My oncologist was actually kind of irritated that the surgeon would even be commenting out of his area of expertise. haha. I didn't want to get in the middle of that. I'm really glad for this test, I certainly don't want chemo if I don't need it! I just hope they hurry up with my results already. I've been off work since June and am pretty well recovered from surgery but don't want to go back just to go back off again if I need chemo. What's ovarian suppression? I was told I'm definitely doing Tamoxifen and will need to keep a close eye on my fibroids which Tamoxifen might make worse...
Posts.Title: Oncotype test-waiting and waiting.... brown471 SpecialK

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2013 03:18PM brown471 wrote: Thanks to you both for responding. Yup, I did call the lab (Genomic). I asked if there was any way they could rush it since it's now been over a month. The person I spoke with was nice enough but was very vague and could only say they were currently looking at it and wouldn't give me any estimate of when the results would be available.  The oncologist will only say that if I am to do chemo, as long as I begin within 3 months of the surgery it will be ok. Bleh. Yup, the waiting stinks.

Posts.Content: Aug 9, 2013 01:22AM brown471 wrote: Hi Dani I'm glad you didn't have to do the chemo. I really don't want to but you know I will if I have to. My surgeon told me I should do it no matter what the oncotype says due to my age (42). The onco disagrees and says wait for the test. I'll wait but I'm not happy about it;)
